page.title: 16Droitwich - Farms and Crops
page.content:
The main crops grown in the area around Droitwich are barley, wheat and oats. Smaller quantities of kale, turnips, swedes, sugar beet, beans and oil seed rape are also grown. Market garden produce such as
strawberries, lettuce, tomatoes and cabbage are also grown in this area. The farmers are also increasing the amount of sheep kept. Dairy and beef cows and pigs are also kept. Conservation work is taking place in this area. Taylor Farm is getting into conservation by replanting coppices, beech trees, willow trees, pop trees and restoring ponds to their natural place and state.
